hobby.message: The city looks different through analog photography, doesn’t it?
Urban exploration or just avoiding work?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Not bad. Busy as usual.
Still finding time for my little hobby, crawling utility tunnels around town.
Got interrupted last week. Whole area’s on alert since the scoreless mess.
Nothing I haven’t seen before.
Alright, can’t complain.
You know I unwind exploring old service tunnels. Bit unusual, I guess.
Last time, hit one of those scoreless group checkpoints. Changed the routine.
Harder to find a quiet spot now.
Gotta stay alert down there.
Surviving. Long week.
My hobby keeps me sane—urban exploring, especially old maintenance tunnels and data closets.
Usually off the grid, bit of home-brewed liquor helps the vibe.
With the scoreless districts now, everything’s less predictable.
Almost ran into a collective setting up shop underground the other night.
Feels like even my hiding spots aren't safe from politics.
Hanging in there. Appreciate the pour.
Still poking into old tunnels, call it urban exploration. Been at it years now.
Always bring a flask, a light, and the right tools.
Funny thing, found a wireless relay rig underground last week—scoreless types setting up.
They were jumpy. I fixed something, shared a drink.
Used to have peace down there, now everyone’s claiming the shadows.
Makes you rethink where to hide from it all.
Glad to be off my feet. Thanks, Alex.
I spend free nights exploring sealed tunnels, backup server rooms—the untouched city bones.
Started as a work habit, turned into my thing. Bit of escape, a bit of history.
Used to be no one bothered with old places unless the system flagged repairs.
Now, with scoreless taking over districts, they're moving in on my routes.
Ran into a makeshift commune under Orlinski—turns out I'm fixing gear for rebels now.
Traded repairs for flatbread and some peace, but lost my favorite quiet spot.
Funny, a few years back I was patching BCI boxes for the Council. Now I’m dodging their sensors, same as everyone else.
hobby_answer: Yeah, was out exploring.
Usual spots aren't so quiet anymore lately.
Too many folks lurking since the scoreless started up.
Not as peaceful as it was.
Hard to get proper solitude these days.
Yeah, hit a tunnel last night.
Lots more people down there now—thanks, scoreless movement.
Saw a couple of makeshift camps, nothing fancy.
Feels like they're taking over the quiet nooks.
Makes old routines complicated.
I keep it quick lately.
That's right—wandered through the south utility crawl last night.
Crowd's bigger down there, after the score reversals.
Scoreless groups are setting up their own spaces underground now.
Found home-built water filters near old server racks.
Guess everyone's adapting to this mess.
Less privacy for old-timers like me.
Wouldn't call it boring, though.
Yep, couldn't sleep, so I went deep under the parkway.
Used to be just me, some rats, and static.
After the Council's lockdowns, those tunnels are busier than market day.
Ran into a scoreless crew trying to rig backup lights.
Swapped advice for a taste of their homebrew—not bad, honestly.
Funny how the city's rejects are the most resourceful now.
Noticed my BCI blipped after the visit, but guess that’s life.
Miss when those places were truly mine.
Right, back in the tunnels last night. Sort of tradition at this point.
Years back, I’d go for hours, just me and stray signals—full peace.
Now, after those scoreless made their stand, the old tunnels are getting crowded.
Half the city’s disaffected started building their own systems, right below Council noses.
Saw a homemade solar array in an elevator shaft—clever work for banned folks.
One group had hand-watered gardens near the coolant lines, just living out of system reach.
I helped fix a failing inverter and they let me stay awhile, traded stories.
Thing is, I get more genuine talk under the streets now than topside.
City's upside-down—privacy's gone, but at least someone appreciates decent wiring.
